titles.title: SSI Disability Benefits Reform Act of 1995

To amend title XVI of the Social Security Act to require periodic reapplications with respect to the continued receipt of supplemental security income benefits, to require that the administrative criteria regarding mental impairments be modified, and for other purposes.

bill.summary: 6/30/1995--Introduced. SSI Disability Benefits Reform Act of 1995 - Amends title XVI (Supplemental Security Income) (SSI) of the Social Security Act to: (1) require periodic reapplications with respect to continued receipt of SSI benefits by reason of disability; (2) strike certain restrictions regarding determination of SSI ineligibility; and (3) modify criteria regarding mental impairments.
